div.head: Experiment title:
div.p: However, the data from the complexes with the Holliday junction DNA was of much poorer quality and has been largely ascribed to poor sample concentration coupled perhaps to incorrect buffer background corrections. An example of the Guinier plots for a Holliday junction complex is given in Fig.3 and one can see that in particular even in this best case, the low angle data is very poor. Efforts to compute SAXS model envelopes produced stuctures that made very little structural sene and emphasized the need to collect better quality data.

Thus we proved that the enzyme samples are of sufficent quality and stability to be shipped readily and good data leaing to acceptable models can be collected from them. We are now seeking further time at the ESRF and elsewhere to pursue the DNA complex studies using the knowledge from our first attempts. Fig.3 Holliday junction complex Guinier plot. The best plot from the data collected on complexes of a resolvase with a synthetic Holliday junction construct. The low angle data is of particular concern due to its low quality, which is probably because of sample concentration problems.

figure.head: Fig. 1
figure.figDesc: Fig.1 Guinier plots of free enzymes A) B.subtilis RecU. B) E.coli RusA. C) L.lactis phage 67RuvC.

figure.head: Fig
figure.figDesc: Fig.2 RecU structure. Example fitting of X-ray crystal structure to a SAXS envelope.
